publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-426# David Mundell: Rural Pubs and Small Hotels—That the Parliament recognises that in many rural communities the local pub or hotel plays an important role in the social fabric of those communities; notes with concern that there has been a significant increase in the closure of such pubs and hotels, and recommends that consideration be given to extending the system of rates relief which currently applies to shops and sub-post offices to pubs and small hotels as they play a key role in the survival of their communities.
S1M-426# Rural Pubs and Small Hotels (lodged on 14 January 2000) Michael Russell*, Mr Keith Harding*, Nick Johnston*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-426# Rural Pubs and Small Hotels (lodged on 14 January 2000) Alex Fergusson*
S1M-426# Rural Pubs and Small Hotels (lodged on 14 January 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Mary Scanlon*

S1M-426# David Mundell: Rural Pubs and Small Hotels—That the Parliament recognises that in many rural communities the local pub or hotel plays an important role in the social fabric of those communities; notes with concern that there has been a significant increase in the closure of such pubs and hotels, and recommends that consideration be given to extending the system of rates relief which currently applies to shops and sub-post offices to pubs and small hotels as they play a key role in the survival of their communities. Supported by: Michael Russell, Mr Keith Harding, Nick Johnston, Mr Brian Monteith, Alex Fergusson, Donald Gorrie, Bruce Crawford, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mary Scanlon
S1M-426# Rural Pubs and Small Hotels (lodged on 14 January 2000) Brian Adam*, Mr Murray Tosh*
S1M-426# Rural Pubs and Small Hotels (lodged on 14 January 2000) Christine Grahame*
S1M-426# Rural Pubs and Small Hotels (lodged on 14 January 2000) Fergus Ewing*
